content: late summer nights poncho by kayla crochet love late summer nights poncho i designed this poncho with our cool summer nights we get here in ontario canada in mind of course it doesn t need to be made for that i also love to wear mine in the spring and fall instead of a jacket worsted weight yarn makes it nice and cozy while the granny stitch allows for air to get through this is a simple pattern and i believe can be made by even a beginner it s one size fits most and can easily be made larger by adding more of the repeats as it is made top down also if you prefer it without a cowl neck you don t need to add one as it is added after the rest of the poncho is made have fun and enjoy  for this pattern you will need - 5 5mm hook - approximately 1080 yards of worsted weight yarn i used almost 3 skeins of bernat premium tweeds in the colourway aran tweed - yarn needle for weaving in ends abbreviations chain- chain space- space beg- beginning slip_stitch- slip_stitch st s - stitch es rem- remaining single_crochet- single_crochet double_crochet- double_crochet skip- skip half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet fpdc- front post double_crochet bpdc- back post double_crochet let s get started *note worked in rounds ch3 at beg of round counts as 1st double_crochet * chain 90 slip_stitch to first chain making sure the chain is not twisted round 1 ch1 does not count as a st 1sc each chain around slip_stitch to 1st st round 2 ch3 2dc ch2 3dc in the same st this creates the 1st point of the poncho *skip 2 sts 3dc in next st * repeat * to * 13 more times skip 2 sts 3dc ch2 3dc in same st this creates the 2nd point *skip 2 sts 3dc next st* repeat * to * 13 more times slip_stitch to 1st st round 3 slip_stitch over and into ch2 space ch3 2dc ch2 3dc in ch2 space 3dc each space until you reach next point 3dc ch2 3dc in ch2 space 3dc each space for rem of round slip_stitch to 1st st round 4-10 repeat round 3 round 11 slip_stitch over and into chain 2 space ch3 1dc ch2 2dc in ch2 space 1 double_crochet each st until next point 2dc ch2 2dc in ch2 space 1dc each st for rem of round slip_stitch to 1st st round 12-15 repeat round 11 round 16 slip_stitch over and into ch2 space ch3 2dc ch2 3dc in ch2sp skip 3 sts note* the 1st st you are skipping is slightly covered by the 3dc you just made that s why we skip 3 sts 3dc next st *skip 2 sts 3dc next st* repeat * to * until next point 3dc ch2 3dc in ch2sp skip 3 sts 3dc in next st *skip 2 sts 3dc next st* repeat * to * for rem of round
